title: Programming Fundamentals
description: Introduction to programming using an object-oriented language. Topics include data types, control structures, functions, arrays, and object-oriented design.

title: Computer Science I
description: Fundamental concepts of computer science including algorithms, data structures, and software development methodologies. Emphasis on object-oriented programming.

title: Discrete Mathematics for Computing I
description: Introduction to discrete mathematics relevant to computer science. Topics include logic, set theory, functions, relations, combinatorics, and graph theory.

title: Computer Science II
description: Advanced data structures and algorithms. Topics include abstract data types, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and hashing. Introduction to algorithm analysis.

title: Discrete Mathematics for Computing II
description: Further topics in discrete mathematics for computing. Includes advanced graph theory, recurrence relations, and algebraic structures.

title: Data Structures and Introduction to Algorithmic Analysis
description: Comprehensive study of data structures and advanced techniques for algorithm analysis. Includes heaps, balanced trees, and amortized analysis.

title: Software Engineering
description: Principles and practices of software engineering, including requirements elicitation, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance. Team projects.

title: Organization of Programming Languages
description: Study of programming language paradigms, syntax, semantics, and implementation issues. Comparison of functional, imperative, and object-oriented languages.

title: Database Systems
description: Principles of database management systems. Topics include data models, relational algebra, SQL, database design, and transaction processing.

title: Operating Systems Concepts
description: Introduction to operating system design and implementation. Topics include process management, memory management, file systems, and concurrency.

title: Algorithms and Complexity
description: Advanced algorithms and computational complexity theory. Topics include NP-completeness, approximation algorithms, and randomized algorithms.

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: Overview of artificial intelligence concepts, including search techniques, knowledge representation, machine learning, and expert systems.
